item.title: A Simple Way to Change the Color of the Sky in Camera
item.description:
A Simple Way to Change the Color of the Sky in Camera

Have you ever been excited to photograph someone around sunset only to discover that Mother Nature wasn't playing nice? Instead of a beautiful sunset, you were dealt a grey drab sky as your backdrop. There is a way and it's actually quite simple to pull off.

item.title: Give Your Colors a Nice Kick With This Lightroom Trick | Fstoppers
item.description:
Give Your Colors a Nice Kick With This Lightroom Trick | Fstoppers

The great thing about the program Lightroom is that there are usually a number of different ways to accomplish a task. In this video I show you one fantastic way to create some nice colors in your photo by using a slider tool that you might not have even touched before.

item.title: The One Thing You Should Always Ask Before Hiring Your Wedding Photographer | Fstoppers
item.description:
The One Thing You Should Always Ask Before Hiring Your Wedding Photographer | Fstoppers

It's that time of year! Lots of wedding proposals took place over Christmas and New Year's so couples are now on the hunt for a great venue and team of vendors for their special day. There are many websites and Pinterest boards that like to give advice to brides on what to look for when hiring their wedding photographer.

item.title: Little Known Way to Manipulate Colors in Lightroom | Fstoppers
item.description:
Little Known Way to Manipulate Colors in Lightroom | Fstoppers

For the last month I have shared a useful tip in Lightroom each week and I look forward to continuing the series. For this week I show you how to use the often overlooked color sliders to control the hue, saturation and luminance of each color in your photo.

item.title: Top Lightroom Tip That Your Clients Will Thank You For Learning | Fstoppers
item.description:
Top Lightroom Tip That Your Clients Will Thank You For Learning | Fstoppers

If you are photographing people than you understand the importance of sharpening areas of your images while masking out other parts and keeping them soft. For example, I love to sharpen the eyes, the lips, the hair, but don't want to bring out any unnecessary detail on the cheeks.

item.title: Another Useful Lightroom Tip Your Mom Never Taught You | Fstoppers
item.description:
Another Useful Lightroom Tip Your Mom Never Taught You | Fstoppers

Adobe Lightroom is a program full of many different little tips and tricks just waiting to be discovered. In this short video I show you one of my favorites which allows you to apply a selective focus technique to your photo without having to open it in Photoshop.

item.title: Are You Taking Advantage Of The Survey View in Lightroom? | Fstoppers
item.description:
Are You Taking Advantage Of The Survey View in Lightroom? | Fstoppers

Like Photoshop, Lightroom is a powerful piece of software. Sadly most of us learn the basics and don't take advantage of all that is has to offer. One powerful feature is called the "Survey View." Are you taking advantage of it?

item.title: How To Make Fantastic Wedding Photos Even When It's Raining | Fstoppers
item.description:
How To Make Fantastic Wedding Photos Even When It's Raining | Fstoppers

Rain on your wedding day can be quite a downer for most brides even though many cultures see rain as good fortune, cleansing and fertility. Often brides wonder how they are going to still get good photos if it's raining. Here are some tips for photographers that I've picked up over the years having shot numerous weddings in the rain.

item.title: Simple Tip To Mastering Off-Camera Flash (2-Min Read) | Fstoppers
item.description:
Simple Tip To Mastering Off-Camera Flash (2-Min Read) | Fstoppers

Over the last 12-months there has been a surge of photographers wanting to learn off-camera flash. Regularly I receive emails or Facebook messages from other photographers asking for tips. Over the years I have tried to remember what made learning off-camera flash so easy for me and time and time again it comes down to one simple tip.
